Racial Divide Grows Oprah Goes Online

13 Jul 1999

According to a new report, released July 8th, from the US Department of Commerce, ethnic minorities, rural communities and the poor are still being left behind in the Internet society. Money is the single greatest determinant of who has Internet access in the United States says the report by the National Telecommunications and Information Administration.

For the complete article, check out http://www.ntia.doc.gov/ntiahome/digitaldivide/.

Meanwhile, Oxygen Media has announced its committment to "bridge the growing 'digital divide' between those with access to technology and those without." These efforts will be backed by close ties ties to community leaders and a television series "Oprah Goes Online."
